creator: kishore.bhamare@gmail.com
text:
Issue: I am not able to record script using HTTP(S) Test Script Recorder in JMeter 3.0 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Start Jmeter 3.0.
2. Select Workbench-> Add Not test element 'HTTP(S) Test Script Recorder'
3. Add any logic controller, I have added Transaction Controller.
4. Go to HTTP(S) Test Script Recorder select Target controller.
5. Now open mozilla browser and do the proxy setting.
6. Go to HTTP(S) Test Script Recorder click on 'Start'button.
7. it shows Root CA certificate click on OK.
8. Go to mozilla browser and run the URL that needs to be recorded.
9. Getting 'The proxy server is refusing connections'


Apache JMeter Version: 3.0
Mozilla Firefox Version: 46.0.1
URL: http://www.e-zest.net/

Note: Same flow I have tried on JMeter 2.13 and it's working.

This sounds as though you have not added the new certificate to the browser.
The proxy cert will be different for the new release
creator: sebb@apache.org
kishore.bhamare@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to Sebb from comment #1)
> This sounds as though you have not added the new certificate to the browser.
> The proxy cert will be different for the new release

I have already added root certificate and still I am not able to record.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Note that the proxy port was changed to 8888 as a default.
Make sure the recorder and browser agree on the port to be used.
